meanings.definition: Represent (something) as being larger, greater, better, or worse than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: She tends to exaggerate her accomplishments to impress others.
meanings.sent2: It's not good to exaggerate the truth just to make a story more interesting.
meanings.sent3: He likes to exaggerate his fishing tales to make his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement seemed to exaggerate the colors of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The artist used bold strokes to exaggerate the size of the mountain in the painting.
